list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: simple elegance or refinement of movement.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: she moved through the water with effortless grace
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Cô di chuyển qua nước với ân sủng dễ dàng

list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: at least he has the grace to admit his debt to her
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: ít nhất anh ta có ân sủng để thừa nhận nợ của mình với cô ấy

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (in Christian belief) the free and unmerited favor of God, as manifested in the salvation of sinners and the bestowal of blessings.
a period officially allowed for payment of a sum due or for compliance with a law or condition, especially an extended period granted as a special favor.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: một ân sủng ba ngày khác

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a short prayer of thanks said before or after a meal.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: before dinner the Reverend Newman said grace
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Trước bữa tối, Reverend Newman nói Grace

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: used as forms of description or address for a duke, duchess, or archbishop.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: His Grace, the Duke of Atholl
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Ân sủng của anh ta, Công tước của Atholl

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (in Greek mythology) three beautiful goddesses (Aglaia, Thalia, and Euphrosyne) believed to personify and bestow charm, grace, and beauty.
do honor or credit to (someone or something) by one's presence.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: she bowed out from the sport she has graced for two decades
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Cô ấy cúi đầu từ môn thể thao mà cô ấy đã nảy sinh trong hai thập kỷ
